page.title: 03SHOPPING IN THE DON VALLEY
page.content: There are many different types of {shop}in Darnall and Attercliffe, ranging from small local shop to large super-store. {Prices}vary from shop to shop; super markets are often cheaper than local shops. Prices range from fifty pence for a pack of butter to around five hundred pounds for a video cassette recorder. Most people turn to the fish & chip shop or the Chinese take-away for fast foods. A bag of chips can be bought for 25p.,but the Chinese take-away is dearer at 27p. Most large shops take over a number of small local shops, for example last year a chemist and two small shops were demolished in order to build a large{supermarket.
